byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission chairwoman Mary Jo White announces that she will explore setting higher standards for brokers in dispensing investment advice; support of so-called uniform fiduciary duty puts White and her agency in the middle of potential battle between Obama administration and the financial industry.
lead_paragraph: The agency’s chairwoman, Mary Jo White, said she would explore ways to oblige stockbrokers to put their clients’ interests ahead of their own.

headline.main: S.E.C. Chief Voices Support for Higher Advice Standard for Brokers
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Chief May Toughen Rules for Brokers

snippet: The agency’s chairwoman, Mary Jo White, said she would explore ways to oblige stockbrokers to put their clients’ interests ahead of their own.
